channel.title: How well do games run on YOUR specs?
channel.description:
My Pee Cee
Intel Core i5 @ 2.8 GHz P55-UD5 mobo RAID 0 stripe array [3 HDDs] 750 GB total Sapphire Radeon 5770 1 GB DDR5
^ custom builds ftw
Framerates
Half-Life: 100 fps [SD content] Half-Life 2: 299 fps [everything maxed out] HL2: Episode 1: ~20 fps :frowning: [antistropic and antialiasing OFF] Doom 3: 200 fps
**all at a screen resolution of 1600x1200
how do I compare to y'all? LET'S SEE

item.title: How well do games run on YOUR specs?
item.dc:creator: Ramirezoid
item.description:
According to Can You Run it, I’m supposed to be able to run crysis at max settings.

Somehow I doubt that considering how choppy L4D2 can get at times.

Read full topic

item.description:
e6600 2.4 ghz, 3 gb ram, 1 tb 7200 rpm hdd, z5500’s, soundblaster x-fi xtreme
24" crt @ 1920x1200, and 22" lcd @ 1680x1050 on a radeon hd 4850

l4d: 90 fps on 1600x1200
crysis: 45 fps on 1280x1024 all high settings

item.source: How well do games run on YOUR specs?

item.title: How well do games run on YOUR specs?
item.dc:creator: waqwarrior
item.description:
Brother Shrike:

Switching to 8 lanes only lowers your performance by about 4%. going to 4 lanes has a pretty big effect though, so I wouldn’t recommend triple crossfire.

Okay I can live with that… the results are worth it
Triple crossfire is impossible on my P55-UD5 mobo afaik only 2 slots

I would only do triple crossfire if I got a new mobo… not doing THAT anytime soon. I’d get an i7 instead :retard:

Read full topic
item.source: How well do games run on YOUR specs?

item.title: How well do games run on YOUR specs?
item.dc:creator: Tinman
item.description:
I’ll give the specs I know about

This is a laptop, Dell Inspiron e1505, with:
-ATI Mobility Radeon x1400
-Intel Dual Core T2080 1.73 GHz
-2 GB RAM
-Windows 7 Pro 32 Bit

It’s not that great, but does what I need it to. I can handle all source games that I have tried so far (which excludes L4D2) with no problems.

I do like playing S.T.A.L.K.E.R. SoC, but I there are certain maps that are near impossible to play on even after tweaking.

Luckily, I’ll be getting some help in building a new PC soon.

Read full topic
item.source: How well do games run on YOUR specs?

item.description:
I dont know all the intel i# and all that stuff but all I know is:

Intel Penium 4 3.2ghz
1.5gb ram
intel 128 mb video card
40 gb hard drive

Plays hl2 on high (most except when the gun ship is there)

Sometimes it makes me want to cry.

Start up screen says its high threading but everyone that has seen that doubts it.

item.source: How well do games run on YOUR specs?

item.title: How well do games run on YOUR specs?
item.dc:creator: eternalness
item.description:
CrossfireX is the same as nvidia’s SLI, buts its more flexible (ie. u can crossfire a 5870 and a 5850 or 5770, but u cant SLI two different nvidia cards) and each card remains independant which means u can still run monitors from all of the cards even while there linked.

Medevilae:

Where do you get your money? Got a job or just rich parents? (Not implying either, nor saying that your setup is costly, just curious.)

I’ve only spent $1700 total on it starting back when I put together my original config last year. I get some of the money myself, the rest is from holidays and birthdays.

Edit: damn ninja’d

Read full topic
item.source: How well do games run on YOUR specs?

item.title: How well do games run on YOUR specs?
item.dc:creator: Brother_Shrike
item.description:
it is the ATI version of sli. It depends on how many lanes of PCIe your chipset has total - P55 only has 16, so with one card the card gets 16 full lanes, but with 2 you get 2 8 lanes. X58 on the other hand has 32 I believe. Switching to 8 lanes only lowers your performance by about 4%. going to 4 lanes has a pretty big effect though, so I wouldn’t recommend triple crossfire.

Read full topic
item.source: How well do games run on YOUR specs?

item.title: How well do games run on YOUR specs?
item.dc:creator: CTID
item.description:
I was under the impression that Crossfire was ATi’s version of SLi, which is using two different cards in two different x16 slots. Or more cards/slots as necessary.

Read full topic
item.source: How well do games run on YOUR specs?

item.title: How well do games run on YOUR specs?
item.dc:creator: waqwarrior
item.description:
CTID:

324w is bullshit. One probably uses about that much, much less three.

Max output for one radeon HD 5770 is 108W
and plus, if I do crossfire, The 1 x16 slot will turn into two x8 slots = slower afaik… will that impact performance much?

Read full topic
item.source: How well do games run on YOUR specs?

item.title: How well do games run on YOUR specs?
item.dc:creator: Medevilae
item.description:
eternalness:

Your not showing off much cause system is pretty average and u can barely run ep1. If u want to show off ur system, show benchmarks of demanding games.

Specs:
Case: Coolermaster HAF 932
CPU: Intel i7 920 @ 3.7ghz
CPU Cooler: Coolermaster V10
Motherboard: Asus Rampage II Extreme
GPU: Two XFX Xtreme Edition 1GB GDDR5 4890s In CrossfireX + 8800GT PhysX
RAM: 6GB (2x3GB) Crucial Ballistix DDR3 1600
Power Supply: Ultra X4 1050W Modular PSU
Keyboard: Saitek Eclipse Blue LED Version
Mouse: Logitech MX518 Gaming Mouse
Sound Card: Republic of Gamers Creative Supreme FX X-Fi
Screen: 22in 1680x1050 Dell SP2008WFP
Hard Drive: One Western Digital 500GB 7200rpm SATA II
Speakers: Cyber Acoustics Gaming Series 2.1 Speaker Set
Headset: Creative FATAL1TY Professional Edition Circumural Gaming Headset MK. II
OS: Windows 7 Ultimate 64bit Retail

Crysis(DX10): 60fps avg max’d out with 4x AA and 16x AF @1680x1050.

GTA4: 87fps avg max’d (no AA or AF options) out with view distance and shadow/car density as far as the settings will let me go @1680x1050.

STALKER Clear Sky(DX10.1): 72fps avg max’d out with 4x AA (DX10.1 style) 16x AF @1680x1050.

Cryostasis(DX10): 80fps avg max’d out with AA and AF (no option of how high) and hardware PhysX @1680x1050.

Where do you get your money? Got a job or just rich parents? (Not implying either, nor saying that your setup is costly, just curious.)

Read full topic

item.title: How well do games run on YOUR specs?
item.dc:creator: waqwarrior
item.description:
Smokin’ hot machine Schizophriend!

I want to run Episode 2 at more than 30 FPS… I’m going to runn CrossfireX (3) for my 5770 … maybe. I can’t decide on 2 or three. My PSU is 750W + 3.7 GHz CPU… will that be too much for it? I saw the max for crossfirex3 as far as wattage goes was like 324w. Advice please

Read full topic
item.source: How well do games run on YOUR specs?

item.title: How well do games run on YOUR specs?
item.dc:creator: Schizophriend
item.description:
This is a brand new computer that isn’t even 2 weeks old yet. First computer I put together myself.

AMD Phenom II x4 965 Black Edition 3.4 GHz
Sapphire Radeon HD 5850 1 GB GDDR5
4 GB DDR3 1333 RAM
1 TB Seagate Barracuda
750 GB WD external
MSI AMD 770-C45 Mobo
Thermaltake 600w PSU
Windows 7 Home Premium 64-bit
Asus 18.5" WS 1366x768 Monitor (40" 1080p HDTV during games)

I can run the Crysis demo, Dirt 2, OF: DR, and Grid all on max settings flawlessly. On my next paycheck I’m going to be buying the Valve complete pack.

I am ready for Black Mesa! :freeman:

Read full topic
item.source: How well do games run on YOUR specs?

item.title: How well do games run on YOUR specs?
item.dc:creator: eternalness
item.description:
Windows 7 has it pre-installed and there are quite a few good DX11 games coming out soon such as STALKER Call of Pripyat (US version) and Battlefield Bad Company 2. Dirt 2 is also a very good game that uses DX11.

item.source: How well do games run on YOUR specs?

item.title: How well do games run on YOUR specs?
item.dc:creator: Madcat1030
item.description:
Which is a moot point, because as of now there are no widely distributed DX11 games.

But also, I never installed/updated anything to DX11. The last DX update I did was with the last game I installed, and it just did whatever it had to do to run. Forget what game it was though…

Read full topic
item.source: How well do games run on YOUR specs?

item.title: How well do games run on YOUR specs?
item.dc:creator: eternalness
item.description:
Ur software level is DX11, but your hardware level is DX10. You can only run games up to what ur hardware level is, even if your software level is higher.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: Brother_Shrike

U only have DX10, only the ATi 5000 series cards have DX11 right now.

installed dx version != dx hardware support

item.description:

The newest game I have is L4D2 and it works ok on the lowest settings but the water effects do not appear. Instead of water I just have a white slab with zombies wading through it, which in some ways makes Hard Rain and Swam Fever alot easier.

item.title: How well do games run on YOUR specs?
item.dc:creator: Madcat1030
item.description:
FPS: 75 solid (minus crysis, which fluxuates from 60 to 75, and on a rare occasional dropping as low as 30 in really busy situations) All settings maxed with max Anti-aliasing and filtering.

Operating System: Windows 7 Ultimate 64-bit
Processor: i7 920(8 CPUs) OC’d to 3.33GHz
Memory: 6.144GB RAM with a 10GB page file
DirectX Version: DirectX 11
Display device: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 285 2GB
Soundcard: I have no idea, but it is a 7.1 surround sound capable card
HDD : 2x 1TB Internal, 1TB semi-permanent external
Peripherals:::
Monitor: Gateway FPD1975W TFT LCD Monitor 1440x900 widescreen resolution.
Mouse: Razer Copperhead
Keyboard: Some crappy generic Microsoft keyboard (my last one exploded)
Speakers: Logitech X540 5.1 Speaker System (got em for 50 bucks)
Various other things that have no impact of system performance…

I only use 1400x1050 resolution, but I really need to upgrade my monitor. That’s my next upgrade.

Read full topic

item.title: How well do games run on YOUR specs?
item.dc:creator: MechUnit
item.description:
AMD Phenom II x4 940 Black Edition
ASUS M4A79 Deluxe mainboard
Aeneon 4GB DDR2 800 MHz CL5 RAM (i will change soon to 8GB 1066 RAM)
Zotac AMP! Geforce GTS250 1GB (2 cards)
1.16 TB HDD-space on 3 harddisks, 2 Samsung HD501LJ Spinpoint F1 HD’s and 1 Maxtor 160 GB HD and a lotta other drives…
Creative X-Fi Extreme Audio
Win 7 Ultimate 64 Bit and Win Vista Home Premium 32 Bit

with that configuration every game runs fine in full HD resolution and full detail except Crysis that lags sometimes and never gets over 30 fps, with all other games i got over 60 to 300 fps

update dec 2010: CPU is runnig at 4x 3,4 ghz now, card is now zotac amp! geforce gtx460/1GB, ram is now OCZ 8GB DDR2 1066, 2 more SATA-HDD’s added, now there’s 1,5TB disk space
